artist: James Siena; Printer: Harlan & Weaver, New York; Publisher: Harlan & Weaver, New York
creditline: The Barbara S. Longfellow Fund for Works on Paper
provenance: Harlan & Weaver, New York (publisher); sold to MIA, 2016.
text: In this engraving, James Siena explores patterning through the use of rule-based mathematical logic, something he calls “visual algorithms.” Merging idea with image, he methodically follows a set of pre-determined instructions that dictate the physical movement of the engraving burin on the copper printing plate. These directives, executed entirely by hand, are responsible for producing a repeating starburst design that makes up the dynamic, shimmering surface of this print, one that appeals equally to mind and eye.
title: Upside Down Devil Variation
